channel.title: Yahoo! News Search Results for global warming
channel.description: Yahoo! News Search Results for global warming

item.title: Apathy About Global Warming May Be Result Of Increased Knowledge (Medical News Today)
item.description: The more you know the less you care - at least that seems to be the case with global warming. A telephone survey of 1,093 Americans by two Texas A&M University political scientists and a former colleague indicates that trend, as explained in their recent article in the peer-reviewed journal Risk Analysis.

item.title: Power politics: world's dim view of global warming (The Age)
item.description: People switched off lights around the world on Saturday, dimming hotels, restaurants and bars to show concern about global warming.

item.title: Earth Hour blackout highlights global warming (AFP via Yahoo! News)
item.description: Australia's largest city was shrouded in darkness on Saturday night as it launched a worldwide campaign stretching from Sydney to San Francisco to highlight global warming.

item.title: Rebuild Out of Global Warming (New America Media)
item.description: Richard Moe, President of National Trust for Historic Preservation, argues that historic preservation has long been a tool with which to fight global warming.

item.title: UN talks on global warming begin (The Scotsman)
item.description: GOVERNMENTS from nearly 200 countries begin talks today in Thailand on a global warming agreement, a process expected to be fraught with disputes.

item.title: The bright side of global warming (Juneau Empire)
item.description: One the one hand, two entire villages are in danger of being swallowed by a newly encroaching sea. On the other hand, the state could stand to profit from global warming - from increased tourism and research dollars, and the expansion of commercial shipping into the Arctic.

item.title: Cities worldwide switch off lights to raise awareness of global warming (Minneapolis-St. Paul Star Tribune)
item.description: Bangkokites witness Earth Hour as lights of the major shopping malls turned off at 8 p.m. local time today. Bangkok joined other major cities of the world in a campaign to raise awareness about global warming by turning off lights of the major shopping malls and business centers.

item.title: Students: Lights out tonight for global warming (Brattleboro Reformer)
item.description: Saturday, March 29 WILMINGTON -- Proving that the smallest of men can move the largest of mountains, a group of Twin Valley High School freshmen have spearheaded an effort to do something about global warming.

item.title: Four W.Va. cities pledge to fight global warming (The Charleston Gazette)
item.description: Four West Virginia cities have decided they can't wait for the federal government to stop global warming.

item.title: Global warming may spell doom for Puri temple (The Times of India)
item.description: PURI: Global warming may spell doom for some of the Orissa's heritage sites, including Puri's Jagannath temple and Konark Sun temple, according to a recent Greenpeace report.
